title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Small-business confidence dropped in August to its lowest level since early spring, as the rise in Covid-19 cases due to the Delta variant put a damper on expectations and turned entrepreneurs more cautious.

---

The hacker or hackers that plundered over $600 million of cryptocurrency assets from Poly Network finished returning almost all the money Friday.

---

Chime raised $750 million in its latest funding round, in a move that values the fintech startup at about $25 billion and sets it up for an IPO as early as next year.

---

Boeing said it would return its Starliner spacecraft to a factory for "deeper-level troubleshooting" to fix stuck valves.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes posted small gains, with the S&P 500 and Dow closing the session at records.

---

A senior Apple executive defended the company's new software to fight child pornography after the plans raised concerns about an erosion of privacy on the iPhone.

---

Sonos netted a legal victory in a dispute with Google, as a U.S. trade judge ruled that some Pixel smartphones and Nest audio speakers infringe on Sonos's technology.
